results.title: People out of time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A study of the Bindubi tribe, Australian aborigines who have mastered their arid, inhospitable environment in the Great Sandy Desert by using every resource to the maximum point of refinement. Filmed on Professor Donald Thompson’s 1963 expedition. Narrated by Leo McKern, filmed by David Corke and Len McLarty, written and presented by Eric Davidson.

results.title: People on Sunday
results.creator_credit: Filmstudio, Robert Siodmak and Edgar G. Ulmer
results.brief_description: This pioneering low-budget film made at the very end of the silent era, was an avant-garde blend of feature and documentary. Its lyrical recording of the streetlife of everyday Berlin owes something to the cycle of ‘city symphony’ films popular in the mid-Twenties. Onto this documentary background is grafted a simple narrative focusing on the interactions between five young Berliners—all played by non-professional actors—who spend a typical Sunday together in and around Berlin. The film launched the careers of all six principal filmmakers involved, and had a huge influence on subsequent film movements including the French New Wave, Italian Neorealist and British Free Cinema movements. This restored version contains important scenes previously missing and features a new score by Elena Kats-Chernin. Written by Billie Wilder, Curt Sidomak and Robert Sidomak. Photography, Eugen Schufftan and Fred Zinnemann. Based on an original story by Curt Siodmak.

results.title: People of Venice
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Gunther V. Fritsch
results.brief_description: A film of contrasts: a workingman’s family living today against the magnificent background of Venice’s past. Tony Biasi and one of his sons repair the big diesel boats that transport passengers on the canals. Sergio, another son of school age, enjoys the everyday life of a Venetian boy, helping a friend transport vegetables, rowing on the canals, and helping with family chores.

results.title: People of the Waikato
results.brief_description: A description of the Waikato River in New Zealand’s North Island and Lake Taupo, its main source. Includes views of waterfalls and rapids, hot springs, and geysers in Waikato thermal valley and hydroelectric schemes.

results.title: People of the rock
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tim Wilson, Nicholas Balla and Clarke Da Prato
results.brief_description: This film follows an Inuit family’s journey to the North Rankin nickel mine. How the hunters became bulldozer and machine operators is explained. Music by Robert Fleming.

results.title: People of the reindeer = The Wind from the west
results.brief_description: Portrays he lives and superstitions of the Lapps. In the spring the reindeer herds go north, tended by all family except elders and school children. Young Nils however, wooed by the voice of the West Wind, escapes the schoolroom in a day dream and experiences the adventures of which all Lapp boys dream. This film is a re-edit of an earlier film “Wind from the West” [012005].

results.title: People of the ponds
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions, Australian Educational Films and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: Another of the Australian educational short films directed and photographed by Noel Monkman using the facilities of the Efftee Studios. This film features the microscopic life in a rock pool of an extinct Queensland volcano. Narration by Frank Thring.

results.title: People of the Peace
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: A summary and analysis of the Peace River district showing the economic factors necessary for an integrated and prosperous development. It is a warm and human story of change from primitive sod-busting to modern, mechanized agriculture and industry, and a tribute to the pioneer spirit which still finds scope in our northern settlement fringe.
